column4: http://i56.tinypic.com/os9092.png first time installing Ubuntu. This is a Windows XP computer. I'd like to install onto my 320GB SATA drive. I'd like to keep my Windows installations on this drive intact, but it's no big deal if I lose them. I don't have a viable method of data backup, I have an unformatted 30GB partition and 169GB of unpartitioned space. I'm really nervous about this and...
...I'd like for someone to walk me through this. (pic related; it's the step I am currently on.)
because the last time I tried installing I ended up totally screwing everything up, and that was last year.
just create a partition on that 169GB free space
